title: Justice Department Opens Criminal Investigation Into Mueller Probe: Report
text:
The Department of Justice has reportedly opened a criminal investigation into former special counsel Robert Mueller’s probe of Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election.

What had been an administrative review closely overseen by Attorney General William Barr has now become a criminal inquiry, two people familiar with the matter told The New York Times in a report published Thursday.

Barr had appointed prosecutor John Durham to the case when it was just a review, though now he has the power to subpoena witness testimony and documents because it is considered a criminal investigation. Durham can also file criminal charges, the Times reported.

Mueller had found in his investigation that Russia had interfered in the 2016 presidential election specifically to benefit President Donald Trump, who has bashed Mueller for investigating the case. Mueller also found several instances of potential obstruction of justice by Trump into the investigation.

This is a developing story. Check back for updates.
description: What had been Attorney General William Barr's administrative review of the Russia investigation has now become a criminal inquiry, according to The NY Ti...
